attributes.action: Lower bus fares in medway, and provide children with free summer travel
attributes.additional_details: The current cost of living crisis has made life hard for manu people, and for some who might be reliant on public transport, the rising bus fares over the country including medway havr made life difficult. Moreover, 16-18 year olds being charged adult prices is unfair, as they have a lower minimum wage and fewer current qualifications
attributes.background: Subsidies bus companies in medway to provide children with easier school travel, and people with cheaper travel in general; provide youths with free travel during the summer in medway as with the rest of kent

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about funding for local transport are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Fund free public transport for children: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616644
